dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Time to go, stud bucket. Billy sits up.  His heart isn't racing...it's POUNDING.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: See what you do to me. Sweat has popped out all over his forehead, his breathing

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You know what my dad will do to you?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I'm going...I'm going. He moves to the window.  She follows, motioning to his wo

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I appreciate the romantic gesture. She gives him a kiss goodnight.  Sweet and simple.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (whisper) Hey..about the sex stuff. I'm not trying to rush you. I was only half serious. She kisses him again as he eases through the window.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Would you settle for a PG-13 relationship?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What's that? She pulls her flannel gown open for a split second...flas left breast.  His mouth drops open...surprise, shock.  Th meet.  They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Get outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Sidney snuggling her pillow, sleeping peacefully THE RADIO ALARM BLASTS from the night table loud enough t the dead.  Sidney bolts up.

dialogues.speaker: DISC JOCKEY
dialogues.text: (from radio) ..found brutally murdered... CLICK.  Sidney, quick with the reflexes, shuts it off ins A car trunk SLAMS shut outside. Sidney pulls herself out of bed and leans to the window j time to see her Dad jumping in his car.  She half waves d him but he doesn't see her.  He's as good as gone, pullin the driveway and disappearing down the road. A moment as Sidney stands at the window, staring out afte

dialogues.speaker: "BAYBORO HIGH SCHOOL. HOME OF THE FIGHTING BULLDOGS"
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a picture perfect small t school.  Old and charming.  Students come and go, moving Nothing unusual, except for the... six police cars, four news vans, flashing cameras, and cr crowds of lookie-loo's gathered just off campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney approaches the school seeing the commotion.  Four REPORTERS stand in front of four different cameras giving different news reports. She moves passed a policeman standing guard.  Her interes she stops at the first reporter who is...

dialogues.speaker: GALE WEATHERS
dialogues.text: Thirties.  He smart face is overshadowed by a flashy smil massive mane of chemically enhanced hair.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: (for the camera) The small town of Bayboro, North Carolina was devastated last night when two young teenagers were found brutally butchered. Authorities have yet to issue a statement but our sources tell us that no arrest has been made and the murderer could strike again... ON SIDNEY.  Moved, disturbed.  From behind, a finger taps shoulder.  She spins around to see... Tatum Riley, same age, feisty, carefree.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Do you believe this shit?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What happened? They break away from the crowd and head for school.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Oh God! You don't know? Casey Becker and Steve Forrest were killed last night.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: And not just killed, Sid. We're talking splatter movie killed-split open end to end.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Casey Becker? She sits next to me in English.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Not anymore. Her parents found her hanging from a tree. Her insides on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Do they know who did it?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Fucking clueless-they're interrogating the entire school. Teachers, students, staff, janitors...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: They think it's school-related?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: They don't know. Dewey said this is the worst crime they've ever seen. Even worse than... (stopping herself) Well it's bad. They're bringing in the feds. This is big. Sidney looks back at Gale, her face deeply pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frumpy old woman, MRS. TATE, faces her class.  Her hand together.  A tragic look upon her face.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TATE
dialogues.text: ..a terrible tragedy. An unbearable loss. It's days like today we need prayer in school... Sidney sits near the rear of the room.  The desk in front sits vacant.  Sidney can't take her eyes of it. The door opens and a student opens with a slip of paper. s it to Mrs. Tate.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TATE
dialogues.text: Sidney. It appears to be your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is at capacity...wall to wall with police, and t Some sit, stand, lean... SHERIFF BURKE, a round man in his fifties, wipes the stre his face.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Who's up next? A young officer looks at the clipboard.  This is DEPUTY R better known as DEWEY.  He's a big guy, 20's, handsome in scrubbed-clean boyish way.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Sidney Prescott. Sheriff Burke gestures to bring her in.  PRINCIPAL HIMBRY an old codger of a man wearing a sour face speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Sidney Prescott. She was daughter of...

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We all know Sidney, Mr. Himbry.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: How she doin'?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: She's adjusted well. Maintains an "A" average. You never know she... Himbry stops short, seeing Sidney in the doorway.  He ris seats her.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Hi Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Burke. Dewey. Dewey shakes his head seriously.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: It's Deputy Riley today, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: And your Dad? How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: We're fine. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: We'll be brief, Sidney. The police have a few questions they'd like to ask you... Sidney eyes them all nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students sit at outdoor tables eating lunch.  Crowded at is the "gang".  This consists of Sidney, Billy and Tatum. Next to Tatum, sits her boyfriend STUART, with his arm dr across her back.  He's a Billy wannabe.  Almost the jock, handsome, almost cool.  He tries way to hard. Across the table is the fifth wheel, RANDY.  A tall and g with no such Billy-like aspirations.  A witty jokester wh elevates geek to coolness.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Hunt? Why would they ask if you like to hunt?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I don't know, they just did.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Because their bodies were gutted. Sidney flinches.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Thanks Randy.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: They didn't ask me if I like to hunt.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Because there's no way a girl could have killed them.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: That is so sexist. The killer could easily be female-BASIC INSTINCT.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That was an ice pick-not exactly the same.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Yeah, Casey and Steve were completely hollowed out. Takes a man to do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Or a man's mentality.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (quiet, almost to herself) How do you gut someone? All eyes turn to Sidney.  A serious silence.  And then:

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You take a knife and slit from the groin to the sternum. Sidney shivers down to her soul.  The whole table rolls t at Stu.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: What? She asked.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It's called tact, you fuckrag.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Remember in JAWS when they caught the wrong shark at first and Richard Dreyfuss cut it open to look foe body parts and all they found was a licence plate and all this white milky goo. Stu leans over and socks Randy in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You heard Billy-shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Stu? Didn't you use to date Casey? Stu's taken back, a little off guard.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: For about two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Before she dumped him foe Steve. Tatum turns to Stu, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I thought you dumped her for me.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I did. He's full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: And are the police aware you dated the victim?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: (offended) What are you saying? That I killed her or something?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It would certainly improve your high school Q.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Stu was with me last night.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Oooooh...before or after he sliced and diced.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Fuck you, nut case. Where were you last night?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Working, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I thought Blockbuster fired you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No one's saying you did.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Besides- (perfect Stu mimic) "Takes a man to do something like that."

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I'm gonna gut your ass in a second.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (to Stu) Did you really put her liver in the mailbox? I hear they found her liver in the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (eyeing Sidney) Randy, you goon-fuck, I'm eating here. Stu nibbles at Tatum's neck.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Yeah, Randy, she's getting mad. I think you better liver alone. Stu cracks up at his own joke.  The others just MOAN.  Si about to crawl out of her skin, trying hard to ignore it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge two story country home with a spacious lawn. A yellow school bus stops in front of the house and Sidne off. The house looks big and lonely as Sidney moves up the wal front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into phone) You sure I can stay over?  My dad won't be back til Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (through phone) No prob. I'll pick you up after practice.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Tell your mom I said thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, it's just...you know, the police and reporters...it brings it all back.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I'll be there by seven. I promise

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Tatum.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Later. Sidney hangs up.  She takes a seat at her computer and bo up.  She sits in front of it staring at the blue screen.. reflection staring back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney comes down the stairs, her arms carrying a change clothes, toothbrush, make-up... She opens the hall closet and pulls a small overnight bag top shelf.  Moving into the living room she loads it up, down on the sofa, hitting the TV remote.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: A news reporter fades in.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on TV) The entire nation was shocked today by the teen murders in North Carolina... Sidney switches channels.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: The State Bureau of Investigation has joined forces with local authorities to help catch what the Governor has called the most heinous... The channel switches again.  Gale weathers appears, stand front of the school.  Her white teeth gleaming.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: This is not the first time the small town of Bayboro has endured such tragedy. Only a year ago, Maureen Prescott, wife and mother, was found raped and murdered... An old black and white snapshot fills the screen-a woman, beautiful and familiar.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: eyes frozen, mesmerized by the image.  Suddenly she CLICK off.  Her eyes go to the clock on the end table.  5:45 PM eyes then move to the framed photo next to it...the same white photo stares at her...a healthy, vibrant woman.  An version of Sidney. Sidney curls up on the sofa closing her eyes tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the end table reads 7:15 PM.  Sidney is fast on the couch.  The phone RINGS.  Sidney leaps up grabbing portable phone.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (from phone) Practice ran late. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (eyes clock) It's past seven.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Casey and Steve didn't bite it til way after ten.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm not worried.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Good, 'cause I wanna swing by BLOCKBUSTER and get us a video. I was thinkin' Tom Cruise in ALL THE RIGHT MOVES. You know, if you pause it just right you can see his penis.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Whatever. Just hurry.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Bye. She hangs up the phone.  It immediately RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Tatum?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Hello, Sidney. IT'S HIM.  THE VOICE FROM BEFORE.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hi. Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You tell me. Sidney thinks, trying to place his voice.  It sounds a li distorted.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Scary night, isn't it? With the murders and all, it's like right out of a horror movie or something.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Aha, Randy, you gave yourself away. Are you calling from work? Tatum's on her way over.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Do you like scary movies, Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I like that thing you're doing with your voice, Randy. It's sexy.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What's your favorite scary movie?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Don't start. You know I don't watch that shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (playing along) Because they're all the same. It's always some stupid killer stalking some big breasted girl-who can't act-who always runs up the stairs when she should be going out the front door. They're ridiculous. A brief silence.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Are you alone in the house?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: That is so unoriginal. You disappoint me, Randy.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Maybe that's because I'm not Randy.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: So who are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: The question is not who am I. The question is where am I?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: So where are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Your front porch. This gives her pause.  She moves to the window and pulls drapes.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Why would you call me from my front porch?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: That's the original part. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW.  She can't quite see all of the por

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Well I call your bluff. Sidney goes to the front door.  She unlocks the bolt, uns chain, and pulls the door open...revealing the front porc COMPLETELY EMPTY. She steps out onto it, phone still in hand.  A single lig overhead illuminating the porch, but little beyond.  Dark all around.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: So where are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Right here. Sidney peers out into the darkness past thick shrubs that either side of the porch.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Can you see me right now?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What am I doing? She sticks her finger up her nose, pretending to pick.  S No answer.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Good try, Randy. Tell Tatum to hurry. Bye now.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: If you hang up, you'll die just like your mother. Sidney stops dead in her tracks, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (deadly) Do you want to die, Sidney? Your mother didn't. His seriousness unnerves her.  Sid flies off the handle.

dialogues.speaker: FUCK YOU
dialogues.text: She hangs up on him.  Moves back inside the house.  Locks and bolts the door when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushing her, ramming into her side..the phone flies..the on top of her as she goes down...SCREAMING... She looks up to see the FIGURE, darkly dressed with a pal distorted face, white and ghostly...a mask. Her instincts surface and she kicks up with her foot maki contact with his leg...he topples over...coming right at hand finding her neck.  Suddenly, along, silver blade app above her. Sidney pulls, jerks, twists...finally she lifts her torso knocking the FIGURE off her...sending him reeling into th room.  Wasting no time, Sidney leaps to her feet. She moves to the front door, unlocks it...pulls it open.. catches on the chain.  Shit!  She pushes it closed again behind her..the FIGURE has risen, knife in hand. Sidney pulls on the chain and then-inexplicably turns and RUNS UP THE STAIRS.  The FIGURE right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIGURE leaps at Sidney taking hold of her foot, she g madly at the wall...her hands grasp a framed painting-a q country home, subdued colors, done in oils-she rips it fr wall swinging it behind her... It catches the FIGURE head on, smashing against his skull him backwards, tumbling down the stairs.  Sidney races to bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks the door shut, the pulls her closet door open, the edge right at the door knob just as... THE FIGURE POUNDS AGAINST THE BEDROOM DOOR... ramming it, it rips open, but the closet door catches it crazy vice-like hold. Sidney grabs the desk phone.  It's dead...off the hook do The figure rushes the door several times..the frame splin won't give. Sidney is at her computer, she punches at the keypad madl CLOSE ON SCREEN AS WORDS APPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 SEND
dialogues.text: The knife slashes through the crack in the door wildly.

dialogues.speaker: ELM ST
dialogues.text: Sidney presses SEND when it occurs to her-all is quiet. FIGURE is gone.  A fearful silence.  She looks around...t sound her own rapid, terrified BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Stay calm.  Police enroute." Suddenly a NOISE at the window...Sidney looks up to see..

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: her boyfriend, staring at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Oh Billy...Please...God...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I heard screaming. The door was locked. Are you okay...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He's here. He's trying to kill me... Billy pulls himself through the window.  As he does, a sm object falls from his dark jeans.  It hits the floor as S eyes it...a sleek, compact cellular phone. Sidney stops in her tracks.  Their eyes meet...an eternit SIREN is heard in the distance.  Sidney bolts...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey...wait...what's goin.. Billy reaches for her.  Sidney unblocks the bedroom door out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney nearly falls down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rips the chain off the door, pulls it open, coming fa face with a white, ghostly mask. A massive SCREAM erupts from her gut as...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA PULLS BACK
dialogues.text: to find Dewey-Deputy Riley, holding it.  Red lights flash BLAST vas car after car surrounds the house. Sidney falls into the safety of Dewey's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yard is a whirlwind of activity.  An ambulance, squad cops everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S FACE
dialogues.text: as it SMASHES against the hood of a police car.  His hand being cuffed, his rights being read.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (screaming) I didn't do anything! Sid...where's Sid? Ask her, she'll tell ya... Dewey holds a car door open as Sheriff Burke steps out.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We got him, Sheriff. Billy Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Hank Loomis' kid? Aw..Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: He's her boyfriend. They approach Billy as he's being placed in a squad car.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sheriff...I didn't do it...please, call my Dad..please... The squad car disappears with Billy as another car comes in front of the house.  Tatum gets out, freaked beyond be Back to the Sheriff and Dewey as they storm across the ya

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I was first to respond.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: What were you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Drive by patrol.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: She's tough.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Have to be. The shit she's gone through. Across the yard sits Sidney, in the back of an ambulance PARAMEDICS check her out. Sheriff Burke and Riley approach.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: We're seeing a lot of you today. She tries to smile but fails.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You gonna be able to come down to the station and talk to us a bit?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: ..yeah... TATUM appears, barreling past an OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: What happened? Oh God... Tatum rushes to her, grabbing hold of her.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: (to Tatum) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Sid, I'm sorry I was late.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You can't be here, Tatum. This is an official crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It's okay. She was supposed to pick me up.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Her dad's out of town. She's staying with us.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Does mom know?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Yes, you doofus. Two news vans come driving up the street.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: The vultures are coming. Let's get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, white news van comes to a stop in front of the hou side door slides open and Gale Weathers hops out just in see Sidney being escorted to a squad car.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. Jumping from the driver's seat is KENNY, Gale's cameraman flunky.  An earnest young chap on the chubby side.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Jesus! The camera-hurry! But it's too late.  Sidney is as good as gone.  Gale sees moving quickly to her car.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Tatum looks up to see Gale Weathers rushing her.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Was that Sidney Prescott they took away?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tatum hops in her car, ignoring her.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you. Tatum's car peels out as Kenny comes running up with his

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Where'd she go? Gale spins around, flashing her pearly whites.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Look, Kenny, I know you're about fifty pounds overweight but when I say hurry please interpret that as...MOVE YOUR

dialogues.speaker: FAT TUB OF LARD ASS NOW
dialogues.text: Gale moves back to the van leaving Kenny miffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small town station.  The bull pen is a little square ro four desks and tonight--it's hopping.  Cops everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits at a desk drinking a cup of water.  She wears Sheriff's jacket over her shoulders.  Dewey approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Did you reach my Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You're sure it was the Hilton?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: At the airport.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: He's not registered. Could he have gone to another hotel?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We'll find him, Sid. Don't worry. Sidney stares blankly, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy sits opposite Sheriff Burke.  Next to Billy, sits h father, HANK LOOMIS, an older version of Billy.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: What are you doing with a cellular telephone, son?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It's my phone. He was just playing around with it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: You got some ideas of playing around, boy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I didn't call anyone with it. I just took it for fun.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Everybody's got one now. Why don't you check the phone bill for chrissakes. Call my carrier--AirFone Comp. They'll have records of every number dialed.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Hank. We're on it. What were you doing out at Sidney's tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see her, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: You rode your bike out there?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: And last night? Sidney said you crawled through her window last night too?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (surprised) You were out last night?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I watched TV for awhile but the I felt like going for a bike ride.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Did you ride past Casey Becker's house?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. I didn't kill anyone, Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to keep you, Billy. The governor's got SBI, FBI, and god knows who else on their way down here. Billy fights tears.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: This is crazy. I didn't do it. Sheriff Burke eyes him up and down, very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatum has joined Sidney.  The sheriff's door opens and Bi led out by a coupla UNIFORMS.  Burke and Dewey appear in watching Tatum comfort Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: That ghost mask is sold at both Kroger's and WalMart. Neither of which keep purchase records.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: What about the cellular phone bill?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: They're pulling Loomis' account. But it'll be morning before we see something. You think he did it?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago I woulda said not a chance. But these kids today...damn if I know.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Hey...Dewey. Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Hold up a sec...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: She staying with you?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We haven't located her Dad yet.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Goddammit, Dewey! Dewey turns to her, his face red.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: What did Mama tell you? When I wear this badge you treat me like a man of the law.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Deputy Dewey-boy but we're ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Use the back way. Avoid the circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Sidney, Tatum, Dewey, and a coupla OFF exit avoiding the horde of REPORTERS that can be seen aro corner waiting anxiously at the front entrance.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I'll get the car. Wait here. Dewey takes off.  From the darkness of the alley, Gale We appears with Kenny and his camera.  They've been waiting.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Hello Sidney. Sidney spins around to see Gale, standing, smiling at her Sidney's body tightens and her face goes taut.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Some night. Are you alright? Their eyes meet in cold familiar stare.  Sidney says noth She's visibly shaking.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: She's not answering any questions. Just leave us alone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It's okay, Tatum. She's just doing her job. Right, GALE?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. Dewey, in a squad car, turns into the alley and pulls up. other news people have wisened up.  They begin to flock t

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: How's the book?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: It'll be out later this year. Sidney tries to contain herself..squeezing a clenched fis

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'll look for it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I'll send you a copy. In a blurred, unexpected instant, Sidney brings her fist SMASHING it hard into Gale Weathers's face.  The impact s reeling backwards, knocking into Kenny as they both tumbl pavement. ON SIDNEY...breathing deep, a sense of satisfaction on he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacious bedroom.  Typical.  Tatum and Sidney lay on th They both wear night shirts.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: God, I loved it. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Bitch went down. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Sid--SuperBitch! Dewey appears in the doorway holding a bag of ice.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I thought you might want some ice for that right hook. Sidney sits up, takes the ice, and puts it on her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I'll be right next door. Try to get some sleep. Dewey moves back out the door.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Any word on my Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: (turning to her) Not yet, but we're looking. If you need anything...

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... Dewey smiles, pulling the door closed on his way out.  Si back down.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Just another sleepover at the Riley's.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Just like old times, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, nothing's like it used to be. Sidney rolls over at her side, away from Tatum. A telephone RINGS somewhere in the house.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Do you really think Billy did it?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He was there, Tatum.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I knew this guy was too perfect. He was destined to have a flaw. A KNOCK at the door.  It opens and a friendly, graying wo in.  This is MAMA RILEY.  She wears a comforting smile.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA RILEY
dialogues.text: Telephone, dear.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MAMA RILEY
dialogues.text: It's for Sid

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: My Dad? Mama Riley shakes her head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Take a message.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It's alright. I'll get it. Sidney takes off out the door.  Mama Riley motions to Tat

dialogues.speaker: MAMA RILEY
dialogues.text: (whispers) How is she? Tatum shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney grabs the phone at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (from phone) Hello Sidney. IT'S HIM.  The CAMERA does a Hitchcock as Sidney's entire goes weak..his VOICE moving through her..invading her.  S OUT.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOOO...
dialogues.text: Mama Riley turns in the doorway.  Tatum comes bolting out bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (from phone) Poor Billy-boyfriend. An innocent guy doesn't stand a chance with you.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Looks like you fingered the wrong guy...again.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Hang up, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You'll find out soon enough. I promise. Mama Riley BEATS on a closed bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA RILEY
dialogues.text: Dewey! Dewey!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: This is gonna be fun, Sidney. Just like old times. CLICK. Dewey flies out of his room wearing only his boxers...hol gun.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: What? What? The phone goes dead.  Sidney stands frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun shines high over Bayboro Townsquare.  Car life, townsfolk stir as the picture postcard community aw from a restless sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Tatum sit at the kitchen table, dressed and re school as Mama Riley serves up breakfast.  A small televi on the counter BLARING. Dewey, in uniform, stands near the door, talking on the p

dialogues.speaker: MAMA RILEY
dialogues.text: I think you girls really should stay home today.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Your objection is duly noted.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'd rather be around a lot of people, Mama Riley. From the TV, Sidney hears her name, "SIDNEY PRESCOTT..." go to the television.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on TV) ..who escaped a vicious attack last night was the daughter of Maureen Prescott who was brutally killed last year when convicted murderer Cotton Weary... INSERT of COTTON WEARY, in prison fatigues.  A once hands now haggard and worn.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (cont'd) ..broke into their home and savagely raped and tortured the deceased. Cotton Weary is currently awaiting appeal for the death sentence handed down after the young Sidney testified against him. She was the key witness in the state's prosecution...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It's never gonna stop. Is it? Dewey is off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Billy was released. His cellular bill was clean. He didn't make those calls.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Somebody called me, Dewey. I'm not making it up.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I know. We're checking every cellular account in the county. Any calls made to you or Casey Becker are being cross- referenced. It's gonna take time but we'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: And my Dad? Any word on him? Riley shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, REPORTERS line the street attacking students make their way to school, asking questions, hungry for th teenage insight. Dewey's patrol jeep cruises by.  Sidney watches from the passenger's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey pulls up in front of the school.  Tatum hops out wh lingers, suddenly unsure.  Dewey takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Hey, it's school. You'll be safe here. Sidney forces herself out of the jeep as a microphone is her face...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: How does it feel to almost be brutally murdered? Dewey leaps from the car, intercepting the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Leave the girl alone, will ya? She wants to go to school. Sidney eyes the newsvan that's pulled up behind her.  The door slides open and Gale Weathers steps out.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Come on, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Just a sec...I need to talk to someone. She heads over to Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, puts her head down, hiding her face...avoiding ot reporters as she makes her way to... Gale who sits in the open door, checking her face in a mi Makeup tries hard to hide Sid's handwork-a swollen black right cheek. Gale spots Sidney immediately and leaps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Stop right there. Sidney throws her hands up in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm not here to fight.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Just stay back.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: (calling into the van) Kenny. Camera. Now. Kenny's head darts out from the van.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Off the record. No cameras.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Forget it. Sidney contains herself.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Please. You owe me.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I owe you shit. Gale moves inside the van.  But Sidney is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You owe my mother.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Your mother's murder was last year's hottest court case. Somebody was gonna write a book about it.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: And it had to be you with all your lies and bullshit theories.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What is your problem? You got what you wanted. Cotton Weary is in jail. They're gonna gas him. A book is not gonna change that.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Do you still think he's innocent? Gale's interest is peaked.  She eyes Sidney suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He was convicted in a court of law. Your testimony put him away. It doesn't matter what I think.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: During the trial, you did all those stories about me. You called me a liar.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I think you falsely identified him. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Have you talked to Cotton?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Many times.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Has his story changed?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Not one word. He admits to having sex with your mother but that's all.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He's lying. She wouldn't have touched him. He raped her, then butchered her. Her blood was all over his coat.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He was drunk that night. He left his coat at your house, after your mother seduced him...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I saw him leaving wearing it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: But couldn't it have been someone else you saw wearing that coat? The same person who planted it in Cotton's car, framing him? The same person who really killed your mother? A long beat.  Sidney considers this for the millionth tim

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, Cotton murdered my mother. But there's doubt in her voice.  Gale's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You're not so sure anymore, are you? Sidney clams up.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, it was Cotton. Tatum comes waltzing up.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (to GALE) Nice welt. Gale ignores her, zeroing in on Sidney, half realizing.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: The killer is still on the loose, isn't he? These murders are related.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Yo--let's rock. Sidney starts to fidget.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I mangled your face. She take off with Tatum.  Gale calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Wait, Sidney, don't go... But Sidney and Tatum have already disappeared in the crow students moving across campus. Gale looks to Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! An innocent man on death row. A killer still on the loose. Kenny, tell me I'm dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: You want to go live? Gale's mind races with possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: No, not so fast. We have nothing concrete.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: When did that ever stop you? You can't sit on this. This is huge.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: If I'm gonna blow this up-I need hard proof.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: But it's so much easier when we make it up.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Not this time. I owe Cotton that much. Hell, even I thought that man was guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatum and Sidney make their way across campus.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Just relax. You're at school now. No one can get you here.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: But if it wasn't Billy it could be anybody. He could be here at school right now. They move up the walk as a FIGURE falls in step behind th sporting a WHITE GHOST MASK.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Serial killers are smart by definition. They minimize their risk. They plan and pre-calculate everything. Showing up here would be the most lame-brain move he could make.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He promised me he'd be back. As easy as the figure appeared, it disappears-falling out unseen by either of them.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I wouldn't put too much stock in a psycho's promise. They move up the front steps toward the main doors of the as the GHOST MASKED FIGURE reappears...standing at the to steps...Sidney sees it first, stopping dead in her tracks She steps back, spinning around to find... A GHOST FACE behind her as well, both of them approaching in on her.  Sidney starts to SCREAM when the two ghosts b LAUGHING, tearing off across campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the school we catch up a REPORTER doing a liv He holds a mask in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: This morning several students, in what appears to be a prank, have been spotted wearing masks. School officials have yet to comment but this is the same type of mask worn by the killer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before the bell.  The hallway is congested with stud heading to class.  Tatum is at her locker with Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: This is a mistake. I shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I want you to meet me here right after class, okay? Billy appears in the crowd, with Stu tagging behind.  Tat him first.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Shit, what is he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I bet he's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Just ignore him. You had good reason to think what you did. Billy and Stu approach.  Billy's face is solemn.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hi, Sid. Can we talk a sec? Sidney says nothing.  She can barely look at him.  Tatum intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: You know if I were accused of carving up two people, I'd take the opportunity to skip school.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Hey, go easy, Tatum. He didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Talk to me, Sid. Suddenly, a SCREAM erupts.  All eyes go to a GHOST MASKED running down the hall, screaming wildly, running amuck.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Why are they doing this?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? This is like Christmas. Billy punches Stu in the side.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Owwww...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You open your mouth and stupidity pours out.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sidney, clearly upset, takes off down the hall.  Billy ra after her.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (yelling) Stay away from her, Billy. Tatum SLAMS her locker door shut as the bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With first period underway, the halls have cleared.  One struggling students can be seen rushing to class. Sidney moves quickly down the hall, rounding a corner, ru smack into...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: They collide hard catching Sidney off guard, scaring the of her.  She falls backwards, but Billy catches her fall.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Jesus, SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, it's just me. Sidney pulls away from him quickly.  Billy feels the slig

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What? You don't still think it's me? Sidney catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No...I don't...it's just...Oh God, Billy, someone was there, someone tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: The police say I scared him off. It wasn't me, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I know. He called again last night at Tatum's house.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: See, it couldn't have been me. I was in jail, remember?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...please understand.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Understand what? That I got a girlfriend who would rather accuse me of being a psychopathic killer than touch me.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You know that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Then what is it? Is there somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Is it the sex thing? Am I being too pushy?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, it's me, Billy. I need time. I'm still adjusting to my mom.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It's been a year since she died.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (correcting him) Tomorrow. One year tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: When are you gonna let that go, Sid? When my mom left my dad--I just accepted it. This is the way it is. She's not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (sharply) Your parents split up. It's not the same thing. Your mom left town, she's not in a coffin somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You have to move on, Sid. Sidney starts to walk away but turns back, angry.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm glad to know you're coping so well with life, Billy. But some of us aren't so perfect. Some of us are just trying to hold on. Sidney disappears through a door marked GIRL'S BATHROOM, Billy alone in the hallway.  He SMACKS his forehead, piss himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and spacious.  Closed bathroom stalls line one wall row of sinks and a huge mirror.  Sidney enters as TWO GIR and talk--each from their respective stalls.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: She was never attacked. I think she made it all up.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Why would she lie about it?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: For attention. The girl has some serious issues. Sidney listens intently. A toilet FLUSHES.  Sidney quickly jumps in a stall, hidin as GIRL #1 appears from a stall.  She looks like that voi snotty little twit.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: What if she did it? What if Sidney killed Casey and Steve?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: And why would she do that?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Maybe she was hot for Steve and killed them both in a jealous rage. Another toilet FLUSHES.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Why would Sidney want to be with Steve? She has her own bubble-butt boyfriend Billy.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Maybe she's a slut just like her mom. INSIDE THE STALL Sidney listens.  Her face weakening.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: You're evil.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Please, it's common knowledge. Her mother was a trollop. GIRL #2 appears from her stall--another twit.  They both front of the mirror adjusting two snotty faces.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Cut some slack. She watched her mom get butchered.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: And it fucked her up royally. Think about it. It makes perfect sense. Her mom's death leaves her distraught and hostile at a cruel and inhumane world, she's disillusioned, where's God, etc. Completely suicidal. And one day she snaps. She wants to kill herself but realizes teen suicide is out this year. And homicide is a much healthier therapeutic expression. From the stall, Sidney listens, her heart pounding, jaw q

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Where do you get this shit?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Ricki Lake. The two girls exit.  Sidney moves out of the stall, catch reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Pathetic. Water DRIPS somewhere from a leaky pipe as wind WHISTLES the cracked transom above the bathroom door.  It sound al a whisper,   "Siddneey..." Sidney spins around.  What the...  She checks out the bat The doors to the stalls are all closed.  She bends down a beneath them, looking for feet.  No one.  Nothing. Sidney turns back to the mirror.  Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (o.c. whisper) Siddneey... Unmistakable this time.  The VOICE strikes Sidney like a through the eye.  It comes from one of the stalls.  She s thunderstruck, eyeing the stalls thru the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Is someone there? A long, morose silence.  And then:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (softly, simply) It's me, Sidney. Sidney spins around.  Fuck no!  HE'S HERE.  Terror floods face.  She eyes the exit door, then the row of stalls she pass to get to it. She checks under the stalls again.  Nothing...where the f he?  She takes a step forward when... TWO FEET step down from a toilet onto the floor in the la Sidney's face draws tight as the stall door begins to CRE She bolts forward, making a break for it...but slips on t floor...her feet flying out from under... Sidney reaches out...grabs hold of a sink...saves herself falling...she glimpses a GHOST MASK in the mirror coming A hand grabs her shoulder as she SLAMS her body through t door...narrowly escaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney flies out of the bathroom door SCREAMING...burning hallway, not looking back.  A TEACHER, hearing her SCREAM out from an open doorway...as Sidney sprints by him, not stopping...running madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a red-faced Principal Himbry as he reads someone act.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: I'm sickened. Your whole havoc-inducing, thieving, whoring generation disgusts me. The CAMERA SWINGS AROUND to reveal two GHOST MASKED STUDE standing at attention.  Mr. Himbry rips the mask off of o student's heads.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Two students have been savagely murdered. And this is how we express our compassion and sensivity? He rips the mask off the other student.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: We throw on a mask and dance around campus just hoping someone else gets butchered before we get bored again. You're both expelled. The GHOSTS doth protest...

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: Aw, come on, Mr. Himbry, it was just a joke.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's not fair. A deep rooted hostility has taken over Mr. Himbry's face. student budges, scared to even breathe.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: No, it's not fair. Fairness would be to rip your insides out and hang you from a tree so you can be exposed for the desensitized, heartless little shits that you are. Suddenly the door BURSTS open and Sidney appears, hysteri

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (crying) He's here...I saw him...he's here... Mr. Himbry rushes to her, arms outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Easy child. Sidney collapses in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's patrol jeep is parked in front of the school.  He in the open driver's door talking on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: (from radio) She's okay. Looks like some boys were teasing her. Himbry's shutting down the school though. I want you to take look around.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, sheriff. Dewey shuts the jeep door and heads for campus when Gale appears, her fake face aglow.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Hi! Gale Weathers. Field Correspondent, INSIDE STORY.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I know who you are, ma'am. How's the eye?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Productive. So they're closing down the school?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Well..uh...yes ma'am. For the time being. Dewey heads for the school building. Gale scurries along flirtatiously.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: And why is that? Has something happened?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to be here, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I know, I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker but who knew? Please, call me Gale. You look awfully young to be a police officer. Dewey's eyes wander down to Gale's long legs, the way her move as she walks...he's clearly distracted.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I'm twenty-five years old, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Twenty-five, huh? In a demographic study I proved to be most popular amongst males, 11-24. I just missed you. Of course, you don't look a day over twelve, except in the upper torso area. Does the force require that you work out? Dewey looks away, blushing a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. Because of my boyish good looks, muscle mass has increased my acceptance as a serious police officer. They approach the school's front entrance.  Suddenly, Mr. VOICE in amplified through intercoms across campus via th system.  They stop to listen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: (via PA) "Your attention please. Due to the recent events that have occurred and until it comes to a resolve--effective immediately--all classes are suspended til further notice. The Bayboro Police Dept. has also asked me to announce a city wide curfew beginning at 6 o'clock PM. I repeat..." Gale speaks over Mr. Himbry's voice.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Boy, you people sure do make fuss over a serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Serial killer is not really accurate, ma'am. The killer has yet to strike twice.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Well, we can hope, can't we? We certainly don't have any leads. A ghost mask, a cellular phone--not much there.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We're tracking the cellular phone bill.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Really? You small town guys are good. And have you located Sidney's father?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: No, not yet.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He's not a suspect, is he?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We haven't ruled out that possibil... Dewey, realizing he's said too much, clams up.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Am I keeping you? I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: That's quite alright. If I may say so, ma'am, you're much prettier in person. Dewey starts up the school's front steps as the bell RING

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: So you do watch the show? He turns to her earnestly as STUDENTS come pouring out th doors.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I just turned 25. I was 24 for a whole year.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You are precious. Please, call me Gale. She smiles deliciously, gives him a wink, then struts off Dewey, like a nervous little school boy watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School is clearing out.  The halls have begun to empty as escorts Sidney down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: It was just some sick fuck having a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It was him, Tatum. I know it. Tatum wants to believe her but...

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: You are not to be alone again. Is that clear? If you pee--I pee. Stu appears.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Is this not cool or what? Hey, Sid, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: For once, Stu, drop it.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Okay, but whatever you did--the entire student body thanks you. Stu moves to Tatum and gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: And to celebrate this impromptu fall break, I propose we have a party. Tonight, my house.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: My parents are out of town. It'll be like my hurricane bash last year. Nothing extreme. Just a few of us, hangin'. Tatum warms to the idea.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: This could be good. What do you think, Sid?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Come on. Pathos has it's perks. Sidney considers trying hard to be good spirited.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Remember, there's safety in numbers.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (giving in) Yeah, okay...whatever.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Cool. See you guys tonight. Bring food. Stu speeds off, sliding down the empty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Himbry sits at his desk staring at the ghosts masks b him.  He picks one of them up, snickering.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Damn... He stands and moves to the closet next to his office door pulls it open to reveal a mirror hooked inside the door. the mask on, pulling it over his face, looking in the mir when... A KNOCK AT THE DOOR stops him.  He rips the mask off his turns to his office door and opens it to reveal... AN EMPTY DOORWAY.  He pokes his head into the outer offic and looks around.  But no one's there.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Yes? Hello? The place is empty.  A little suspicious he closes the do catching his reflection in the closet mirror.  He looks a mask in his hands.  Jesus, even he's jumpy.  Two seconds ANOTHER KNOCK AT THE DOOR.  Himbry grabs the door quickly time throwing it open.  Again no one's there.  He steps o the outer office determined to catch a prankster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely empty.  Mr. Himbry moves through the outer off into the school corridor.  The overhead lights have been off and the corridor is now dark and deserted.  He looks down the hall.  Only a JANITOR is seen in the distance pu broom.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HIMBRY
dialogues.text: Little shits. Mr. Himbry returns to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Himbry reenters his office, moving to his desk, when he s closet door NOW CLOSED SHUT. This gives him a pause-he had left it open.  Hadn't he? he can't remember.  He shifts uneasy, reaching for the do pulling the door open to reveal... AN EMPTY CLOSET.  He stands still a moment, suddenly real someone could easily now be standing behind the open clos Nervously, he pushes it shut to reveal... NOTHING.  Himbry shakes away his jitters, realizing he's himself.  He continues to his desk, pushing his office do when... A GHOST MASKED FIGURE lunges from behind it...knife in ha Quick and easy.  Three quick jabs to the stomach and Himb down.  The GHOST MASKED FIGURE towering above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The late afternoon sun is quickly disappearing. Tatum and Sidney rock on the front porch looking out into small town neighborhood.  Dewey's patrol jeep is parked i driveway. Despite loud music, BLARING from an inside stereo, this i moment.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Maybe Cotton Weary is telling the truth. Maybe he was having an affair with your mom.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: So you think my mom was a slut too?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: I didn't say that, Sid. But you know there were rumors. Your dad was always out of town on business. Maybe your mom was a very unhappy woman.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: If they were having an affair how come that Cotton couldn't prove it in court?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: You can't prove a rumor. That's why it's a rumor.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Created by that little tabloid twit Gale Weathers.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (delicately) It goes further back, Sid. There's been talk about other men.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: And you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Well...you can only hear that Richard Gere-gerbil story so many times before you have to start believing it. A long silence as Sidney agonizes over all of this.  She and moves to the edge of the porch and stares out onto th neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: If I was wrong Cotton, then he's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Don't go there, Sid. You're starting to sound like some Wes Carpenter flick. Don't freak yourself out--we've got a long night ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm cracking up. Ignore me.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Come on, let's rock. Sid follows Tatum inside the house never seeing the GHOST FIGURE that stands across the street, under a tree.  His so subtle and unobtrusive you'd have to see this movie a time to know he was there all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu is moving along main street when Billy comes barrelin to him.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Piece of cake. She'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Thanks, butt wart. You did good.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: So you gonna try and make up with Sid?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Duh...that's quick.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I was just asking. Why are you always at me?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Because I'm trying to build your self- esteem. You're far too sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Oh.... Billy thumbs Stu's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You ready to party hard tonight?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You know it. They come to a building centrally located in the heart of Street.  A huge, blue monstrosity that's bigger than the bank and post office combined. The sign in front reads BLOCKBUSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You typical Blockbuster--huge and crowded.  Randy, in his Blockbuster get up, is busy reshelving returns when Stu a knocking the videos out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Jesus, this place is packed.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (picking up videos) We had a run in the mass murder section.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: You coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm off early--curfew you know. (looking off) Now that's poor taste.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: What? Randy refers to Billy who stands down the aisle talking t GIRLS.  (The twits from the bathroom perhaps.)

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: If you were the only suspect in a senseless bloodbath would you be standing in the horror section?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: It was all a misunderstanding. He didn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You're such a little lap dog. He's got killer printed all over his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: The why'd the police let him go?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Because, obviously they don't watch enough movies. This is standard horror movie stuff. PROM NIGHT revisited. Randy moves down the aisle, reshelving videos.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Why would he want to kill his own girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: There's always some stupid bullshit reason to kill your girlfriend. That's the beauty of it all. Simplicity. Besides, if it's too complicated you lose your target audience.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: So what's his reason?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe Sidney wouldn't have sex with him.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: She's saving herself for you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Could be. Now that Billy's tried to mutilate her, you think Sid would go out with me?

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I think her father did it. How come they can't find his ass?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Because he's probably dead. His body will come popping out in the last reel somewhere...eyes gauged. See, the police are always off track with this shit, if they'd watch PROM NIGHT they'd save time. There's formula to it. A very simple one. Everyone's always a suspect--the father, the principal, the town derelict...

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Which is you...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: So while they're off investigating a dead end, Billy, who's been written off as a suspect, is busy planning his next hunting expedition.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (o.c.) How do we know you're not the killer? Randy spins around to find Billy right behind him.  Buste

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Uh...hi, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Maybe your movie-freaked mind lost it's reality button? Randy shrugs, laughing it off.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You're absolutely right. I'm the first to admit it. If this were a scary movie, I'd be the prime suspect.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: And what would be your motive?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It's 1995--motives are incidental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's patrol jeep makes it's way down mainstreet.  It's dark.  The street is close to deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's behind the wheel having a heated conversation wit while Sid stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: A party? Mom's gonna kill you. Then me.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Don't be so self-righteous. It's just a little blow out--we'll be perfectly safe. Sid stares out the window. CLOSED SIGNS fill the storefro few people rush to their car, in a hurry to beat curfew.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: God, look at this place, it's THE TOWN THAT DREADED SUNDOWN.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Hey, I saw that movie. True story, 'bout some killer in Texas.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Hey, Sid. Just think if they make a movie about you. Who's gonna play you?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Oh, god... Dewey comes to a stop, parking the car in front of the po station. He looks to Sid with a brotherly smile.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I see you as a young Meg Ryan myself.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dewey. But with my luck they'd cast Tori Spelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pile out of the jeep.  Dewey heads for the station.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I'll just be a few minutes. Don't go far. The girls take off for the local supermarket that sits ac street.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Is Billy going to be there tonight?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: He better not be. I told Stu to keep his mouth shut. I think we can live without EVERYBODY'S ALL AMERICAN for one night. They approach the grocery store.  Small and simple.  Sid grab a shopping cart from the bin and enter the store, pu cart through two sliding glass doors. A lone CHECKOUT LADY behind the counter, big and frumpy, from counting money.

dialogues.speaker: CHECK OUT LADY
dialogues.text: You girls gonna have to hurry it up. We're under curfew.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Two minutes tops. They make a bee-line for the junk food section just as th automated doors slide shut behind them and a... GHOST MASKED FIGURE appears, out of nowhere, standing jus outside, watching, quietly through the glass store window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Burke's face heats up as Deputy Riley marches in, hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Dewey! Where the hell you been, boy?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Keeping my eye on Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Listen up, Dewey, because it's bad. Real bad. Aircomp just faxed us. The calls were listed to Neil Prescott--Sidney's father. He made the calls with his cellular phone. It's confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Couldn't his cellular number have been cloned?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: There's more. Guess what tomorrow is? The anniversary of his wife's death. It all fits. He's our man.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Have you contacted the bureau?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: They believe he's out of state by now. We'll keep roadblocks and curfew in effect through the night. If he's not picked up by morning--we'll do a house to house.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You think he could still be in town?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: He'd have to be crazy. Where's Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: She's with my sister. Should I bring her in?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Hold off for now. Just stay close to her.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: She'll be with her friends over at Stu Maker's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
dialogues.text: Watch her. Don't let on--just keep your eyes out.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Tatum push a basket through the junk food sect store is completely empty.  The girls gab freely.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Billy's right. Whenever he touches me, I just can't relax.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: You have a few intimacy issues as a result of your mother's untimely death. It's no big deal. You'll thaw out.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: But he's been so patient with me, Tatum. You know, with all the sex stuff. How many guys would put up with a girlfriend who's sexually anorexic?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Billy and his penis don't deserve you. Sidney grabs some chips and salsa from the shelf.  Down t through the storefront window the GHOST MASKED FIGURE sti watching their every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pushes the cart out of the glass door with Tatum ridi The GHOST MASKED FIGURE is nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What do you think about when you're having sex?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: With Stu, there's little time to stop and reflect. But sometimes before, to relax and get in the mood, I think about Grant Goodeve. Sid pushes the cart and Tatum across the street.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Grant Goodeve--the oldest brother on EIGHT IS ENOUGH. Remember that show? He was the one who lived off alone. He would come around every now and then with his guitar and sing "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." He had all these brain dead sisters and that idiot brother from CHARLES IN CHARGE. God, I was in love with Grant, he was so hot. The show came on every day after school right during my puberty years. Grant Goodeve was very instrumental in my maturing as a woman.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: How does that get you in the mood with Stu?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: During foreplay, I sing the theme song to myself. "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." It's a real turn on.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Grant wrote the song himself. I'm convinced the lyrics had a secret meaning, "Eight is enough..." Sid pushes the cart up to Dewey's jeep.  Tatum hops off.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What secret meaning? Like a Satanical thing?

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Watch the show, Sid. His basket is bigger than the one you're pushing.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Oh, Sidney. WHAT? A guy can talk tits til he's dead but the minute you mention an eight inch weenie. Watch out. Sidney stops just short of a laugh.  Tatum pulls the back door, loading the groceries in.  Behind her, the GHOST MA FIGURE appears, just out of their sight, behind the jeep' back door.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: There's that sense of humor. I knew it still existed. Ohh, Sid, let's have some fun tonight.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Deal. Sidney moves to the back door and closes it shut, when fr behind... DEWEY stands.  Sid jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You girls ready.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Looks like I'm your personal bodyguard tonight, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: No, Dewey. You'll ruin the whole night.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Sorry, police orders. I'll stay out of the way, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Shit. Tatum kicks the shopping cart out of the way, blindly.  I down the road by itself, gaining speed on a decline runni into the GHOST MASKED FIGURE who stops the cart cold with hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's jeep makes it's way down a long, winding road.  H illuminate the thick woods that line each side.  Followin them at a discreet distance is a huge white newsvan. Dewey comes to the end of the road.  It dead ends at... STU'S HOUSE which sits alone in a clearing, big and omino no neighbors in sight.  A huge old home just ripe for a n fun and...terror. From the looks of things the party has already started. BLARING. A few KIDS hang on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big room with KIDS sprinkled throughout-smoking, drinki cutting up.  A stereo BLASTS music while the TV airs arou clock killer coverage. Tatum and Sid enter with groceries.  Various FRIENDS gree

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: Caterer's here. The girls carry bags through a hallway that opens up onto enormous kitchen.  Stu and some GUYS are leaning over the drinking beer through a funnel.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: That's mature.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Where you guys been? We had to start without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newsvan pulls up and parks unobtrusively on the side road a few feet down from the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny and Gale move around inside the van.  Kenny hovers control panel complete with video monitors.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Prep the compact, we'll hide it in a window and tape all of tonight's festivities. Kenny picks up a compact video camera the size of his fis checks its battery pack.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: The control board's glitched. You know we can't carry a live picture.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What's the delay?

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: About thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: As long as it records I don't give a shit. We're not doing a remote. Gale slides open the side door and steps out into the dar not seeing the FIGURE that stands behind her.  A hand gra shoulder, Gale's heart stops as she spins around to find. Dewey, smiling, extremely pleased to see her.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Evening, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Deputy...good evening.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: What brings you out to these parts?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You never know when or where a story will break.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Not much story here. Just a bunch of kids cutting loose.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Keeping an eye on things. Checking the place out.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Mind if I join you? Dewey considers for a whole two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Not at all. Gale leans in the van, grabs the camera from  Kenny's han throws it in her bag.  She gives Kenny a wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a microwave.  Popcorn POPS inside.  CAMERA WIDEN REVEAL... Sid, Stu, and Tatum moving about the kitchen, preparing a food feast.  Other TEENS pop in and out. Randy appears am them.  He carries an armful of videos.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I thought we'd make it a BLOCKBUSTER night. He lets the videos splatter across the kitchen counter. Tatum dive in.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: I thought everything was checked out.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I had 'em hid in the foreign section. Sidney peruses the videos.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOG, TERROR TRAIN, PROM NIGHT
dialogues.text: --How come Jamie Lee Curtis is in all these movies?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: She's the Scream Queen.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: With that set of lungs--she should be.

dialogues.speaker: TATUM
dialogues.text: (to Sid) Tits--see.

Maternal abandonment causes serious deviant behavior. It certainly fucked you up. It made you have sex with a psychopath.
